title: [SOLVED] 820-3115 Liquid damage
message:
Hey. Have this board with liquid damge missing PP3V42. Obvious damage was under the heatsink bar leading to the fins which I replaced as well as U5010. I now have PP3V42 with a green light but only for a minute with 1 fan spin. In diode mode I get 0.088 but this seems to be getting pulled to ground at pin 2 of L4901. Seeing that there isn't must between this point and the SMC is it safe to assume its time to replace the SMC? Or am I off the trail all together. LOL. I have already tried reflow with no success. I have never had to replace an SMC before so I have to buy the materials. Can someone suggest balls or paste? If so which ones exactly. Also which stencil do I use for this board? Along with anything else. Does it matter which stencil holder i get? Much appreciated. Have a good one.

Moderator edit: recommended solder paste and recommended SMC stencil.

title: [SOLVED] 820-3115 Liquid damage
message: When the charging light goes out again, does PP3V42 stay?

title: [SOLVED] 820-3115 Liquid damage
message: Hi. Thanks for your response. PP3V42 is now holding steady. Still 1 fan spin. 0.128V on pin 1 C4920. 3.47V on pin 2 of L4901 and pn1 of C4901. PP3V42 in diode 0.088 with L4901 in place. if I remove L4901 I get 0.338. Thanks

title: [SOLVED] 820-3115 Liquid damage
message: Either your SMC is dead or it has crap on it. Normal diode mode for 3V42 is .320ish. I assume you ruled out C4901.

title: [SOLVED] 820-3115 Liquid damage
message: Yes. Replaced SMC today. All is good. Thanks, have a good one.
